message.content:
cs.AI, cs.LO, cs.PL, cs.DS, cs.SE. 

The paper discusses answer set programming, which is a subfield of artificial intelligence (cs.AI) that deals with declarative programming and combinatorial search problems. The paper specifically focuses on disjunctive logic programming, which falls under the category of logic in computer science (cs.LO). The use of transition systems to model and analyze solvers is a technique commonly used in program verification and model checking, which falls under the category of programming languages (cs.PL). The paper also discusses the complexity of reasoning within disjunctive logic programming, which is a topic in computational complexity theory (cs.DS). Finally, the paper discusses the design and implementation of disjunctive answer set solvers, which falls under the category of software engineering (cs.SE).
